alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 07 at 5:34PM AKST until November 09 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM WEDNESDAY TO 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin along the Richardson Highway south of the Edgerton Cutoff and the Glenn Highway from Mendeltna west to Sheep Mountain. * WHEN...From 3 AM Wednesday to 9 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Richardson Highway south to Thompson Pass, heavy wet snow will begin to accumulate early early Wednesday morning. Warm air will mix in from the southeast, transitioning to a rain snow mix or all rain by Wednesday afternoon. Snow accumulation will vary throughout this are based on the timing of transition from snow to rain. For the Glenn Highway, the highest snow accumulations are expected near Eureka and Tahneta Pass, with 12 to 20 inches of accumulation expected. For the Edgerton Highway and McCarthy road, temperatures are expected to rise above freezing through the morning, but ice accumulation up to 0.15" is possible before transitioning over to rain.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
